sentences.english: In Hitler's entourage this drawing was regarded as blasphemous.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒周圍的人把我這幅畫看作是侮漫不敬。

sentences.english: Doesn't your great pride fear the gods any longer?
sentences.chinese: 你已經傲慢自大到連神都不敬了嗎？

sentences.english: Have you disrespected your mother and father?
There are many situations in which a few noisy profanities do, somehow, make one feel better.
sentences.chinese: 有很多吵鬧的對神不敬的時候，能使人感到好一些。

sentences.english: Needless to say, all the above are more useful than revenge and disrespect.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸置疑，這要比仇恨和不敬更有益。

sentences.english: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
sentences.chinese: 別讓不敬虔的人作王，免得他危害人民。

sentences.english: His irreverence for authority marks him out as a troublemaker.
sentences.chinese: 他對權威的不敬使他成了一個惹是生非的刺兒頭。

sentences.english: Actor and comedian Gilbert Gottfried was fired by Aflac after tweeting jokes about the earthquake and tsunami in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一位喜劇演員因爲對日本地震的不敬言辭被炒了魷魚。

sentences.english: And he who pursues pleasure will not abstain from injustice, and this is plainly impiety .
sentences.chinese: 追求快樂的人將不會戒除不義，而這顯然也是不敬。

sentences.english: I need hardly say, a very grave offence.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，這是大不敬的事。

sentences.english: If you do not add smecta, North Korea will be considered disrespectful.
sentences.chinese: 如果不加思密達，在朝鮮會被認爲是不敬。

sentences.english: Notice that the one requirement for receiving justification by faith is to be ungodly.
sentences.chinese: 請注意不敬虔的罪人是因信稱義的一個必要條件。

sentences.english: And he who pursues pleasure will not abstain from injustice, and this is plainly impiety.
sentences.chinese: 追求快樂的人將不會戒除不義，而這顯然也是不敬。

sentences.english: To disobey or disrespect the guru.
Make no vainglorious boasts, I beg you.
sentences.chinese: 我懇求莫要在說些不敬的吹捧了。

sentences.english: Indeed, I realise now that the title I chose for my lecture might even strike you as a little offensive.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我覺得我選的演講題目對你有點大不敬。

definition: to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
